articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK-China Agreement on Cooperation Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK-China Agreement on Cooperation Marked
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Culture and the Ministry of Commerce of China gave a reception in Beijing on December 4 to mark the 55th anniversary of the conclusion of the DPRK-China agreement on economic and cultural cooperation.
					Present there on invitation were Ambassador Choe Jin Su and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Beijing. Minister Cai Wu and the vice-minister of Culture of China and other officials concerned were on hand.
					
					Cai Wu said at the reception that 55 years ago, Premier Zhou Enlai and President Kim Il Sung signed the said agreement to indicate the orientation of development of the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries after they won the great victory in the joint struggle against the imperialist aggression.
					
					The agreement gave a strong impetus to the development of the cause of socialist construction in the two countries and set an example of friendship and cooperation among countries in the economy and culture, he noted, adding: There have been serious changes in the international situation in the 21st century. But, the two countries have steadily achieved fresh victories in socialist construction by their joint efforts and the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties, the two countries and the two peoples have been constantly consolidated and developed.
					
					Choe Jin Su said that the conclusion of the agreement laid a solid foundation for further consolidating the DPRK-China friendship and steadily expanding and developing exchange and cooperation in the economy and culture. This year alone, both sides have fully demonstrated the vitality of the agreement through brisk exchange and cooperation in various domains.
					
					He expressed belief that exchange and cooperation in the economy, culture and other various domains would further develop by the joint efforts of both sides in 2009 marking the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries, and thus record a new brilliant chapter in the history of the DPRK-China friendship.

articles.title: Press Conference and Film Show Held at Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Press Conference and Film Show Held at Cuban Embassy
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- A press conference and film show took place at the Cuban embassy here Tuesday on the occasion of the World Day of Human Rights.
					Present there were media persons in Pyongyang.
					
					Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Jose Manuel Galego Montano and staffers of his embassy were on hand. 
					
					The Cuban ambassador spoke at the press conference.
					
					 He referred to the fact that Cuba has achieved successes under the uplifted banner of socialism since the victory of the revolution and the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations have developed.
					
					He strongly demanded the closure of the prisons in the U.S. naval base in Guantanamo and the release of Cuban patriots now illegally detained in the U.S.
					
					Then, he answered the questions raised by reporters.
					
					At the end of the press conference, the participants watched a Cuban documentary film.

articles.title: Celebrated Mountains and Beauty Spots Imbuing People with Patriotism
articles.content:
Celebrated Mountains and Beauty Spots Imbuing People with Patriotism
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Korean people bear great national pride and patriotism in mind, seeing celebrated mountains and beauty spots.
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited Mts. Kuwol, Jongbang and Chilbo, Ryongmun Cavern and other famous mountains and scenic beauties of the country and instructed officials that they should be arranged well as places for people's cultural rest.
					
					At Mt. Kuwol, he said that socialist patriotism is specific feelings stemming from valuing and loving each blade of grass and each tree of the country and at the newly discovered and arranged Songam Cavern that the cavern is a precious asset of the country to be handed down to the posterity.
					
					Over the last 10-odd years, Mt. Chilbo, which had been neglected for thousands of years, has turned into one of the six celebrated mountains of the country and many noted mountains and beauty spots such as Ullim Falls, Kusul Falls, Pidan Falls, Ryukdam (six ponds) have been discovered only to be converted into wonderful sites for cultural rest and places for education in socialist patriotism.
					
					The Ministry of Culture, the Ministry of City Management and the Ministry of Land and Environment Conservation, provinces, cities and counties across the country are exerting efforts on the education in socialist patriotism through noted mountains and scenic places while conducting colorful activities to broaden historical and cultural knowledge and common sense among the working people and school youth and children.
					
					Guide maps of the Songam Cavern, Mt. Chilbo and other scenic beauties have been brought out this year and the project for updating the illumination of the Ryongmun Cavern is progressing apace so that the visitors can see the beauty spot better.
					
					The looks of Moran Hill and Mt. Ryongak in Pyongyang, Sokdamgugok, Pakyon Falls, picturesque places of Mt. Jangsu and Mt. Paekun and other famous mountains and places have been changed radically so as to implant great pride of living in the socialist country in the minds of the visitors.

articles.title: American-Style "Anti-Terror War" Assailed
articles.content:
American-Style "Anti-Terror War" Assailed
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The U.S. National Security Agency regularly tapped the telephone messages exchanged between Tony Blair, the then prime minister of Britain, and al-Yawer, the first head of the provisional government of Iraq, in 2003, according to the information available recently. Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					At that time Britain and the provisional government of Iraq were in the position of the "friendliest countries" in the "anti-terror war" launched by the United States. The U.S., however, put even these countries under the strict surveillance, an indication that this American-style "anti-terror war" poses considerable problems in its moral aspect.
					
					The fact that the U.S. stretched its tentacles of surveillance even to leaders of its allies suggests that the whole world has, in reality, become the target of the American-style "anti-terror war" and all countries and people have fallen victim to it.
					
					The U.S. is now violating the sovereignty of sovereign states in various parts of the world and killing innocent civilians there, while perpetrating human rights abuses as it pleases, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					This is a violation of international law and the UN Charter, but the U.S. is justifying it as an "anti-terror war". It asserts that its military actions do not pose any problem as they are part of the "anti-terror war".
					
					Precisely on the basis of this gangster-like logic the U.S. invaded Iraq and Afghanistan and made air-raids on Pakistan, a sovereign state, shortly ago, massacring peaceable inhabitants.
					
					The American-style "anti-terror war" causes more losses than gains and it is used as a lever for perpetrating military invasion against other countries and infringing upon their sovereignty. Therefore, the international community is unanimous in asserting that there is no need to allow this crime to go on.
					
					The "anti-terror war" waged by the U.S. is nothing but leverage to execute its foreign policy for hegemony. 
					
					The U.S. would be well advised to stop at once the farce of making a mockery of the international community under the hypocritical slogan of "anti-terror war".

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries Urged to Drop Their Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries Urged to Drop Their Hostile Policy toward DPRK
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries' racket for suppressing the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) comes under fire by signed commentaries of newspapers Tuesday.
					The security department of the Tokyo Metropolitan Police Office of Japan arrested the former vice-chairman of the Tokyo Metropolitan Shinjuku Association of Korean Workers in Commerce in Japan while searching the offices of the Federation of Korean Workers in Commerce in Japan on Nov. 27. In the wake of this repressive action the department arrested the chief of the General Affairs Section of the organ on a groundless charge. Terming these actions hooliganism utterly disregarding law, human rights and ethics, Rodong Sinmun observes:
					
					These actions of Japan are nothing but despicable anti-Chongryon rowdyism as they were a revelation of its extreme hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					The Japanese reactionaries are making desperate efforts to take revenge upon the DPRK through a vicious campaign to crack down upon Chongryon and thus escape from international isolation and destruction.
					
					Their brutal crackdown upon Chongryon and the Koreans in Japan is something unprecedented since the end of the Second World War. This has exposed the right of Chongryon and the Koreans in Japan to exist to grave threat. The Japanese reactionaries are, indeed, a group of hooligans and rogues bereft of an iota of conscience, humanity and morality.
					
					It is all the more mean and wicked for the Japanese reactionaries to frantically kick up the racket of suppressing the Koreans who live in Japan in sorrow and mental agony far away from the homeland.
					
					The Japanese reactionaries will certainly be forced to pay for the crimes they have committed by persistently cracking down upon Chongryon, pursuant to the hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					Minju Joson says that their anti-Chongryon campaign is a product of their anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK. The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to behave themselves, clearly understanding the Koreans' mounting bitterness toward Japan, it warns.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Shameless Remarks Refuted
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Shameless Remarks Refuted 
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The group of traitors including their minions of the Ministry of Unification and the Grand National Party of south Korea are busy with the smear campaign against the DPRK, asserting that "it drove the south-north relations to collapse." Meanwhile, they are justifying their "policy toward the north" and the ultra-right conservative organizations' anti-DPRK leaflet-scattering and going so shameless as to pretend to be interested in the inter-Korean relations, talking about "dialogue between authorities."
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					Such acts are nothing but premeditated moves to cover up the crime they have committed by driving the inter-Korean relations to a stalemate and evade their responsibility and attain their sinister purpose under the signboard of "dialogue."
					
					It was none other than the Lee Myung Bak group which negated the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and stood in the way of implementing them and thus pushed the favorably developing inter-Korean relations to the phase of confrontation.
					
					It is the height of folly for them to put their indelible crimes on the shelf and make rhetoric in a bid to lay the blame for the bedeviled inter-Korean relations at the door of the north which has made every sincere effort to prevent the inter-Korean relations from festering.
					
					With neither artifice nor sleight of hand can the Lee group cover up their true colors as treacherous and anti-reunification elements who are dead-set against the improved inter-Korean relations and national reunification.
					
					Their crimes are indelible down through generations and, accordingly, they will have to pay a thousand-fold price for them.

articles.title: More Dynamic Struggle for Peace Called for
articles.content:
More Dynamic Struggle for Peace Called for
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- It is a pressing task facing progressive humankind at present to curb and frustrate the imperialists'  moves for aggression and war and defend global peace and security.
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes this in a signed article.
					
					It goes on:
					
					To defend peace is an essential requirement for international security and development, a common cause of humankind as well as an international duty.
					
					It is necessary to be vigilant against the hypocritical "defense of peace" and "guarantee of international security" much touted by the imperialists. They are persistent in high-handed practices and reckless moves for aggression while insisting that they are for the "defense of peace" and "guarantee of international security."
					
					Only when all the anti-imperialist independent and peace-loving forces in the world unite to struggle against the imperialists' moves for aggression and war can they avert a war and ensure international security and peace.
					
					The struggle against war has become a main form of the struggle for international security and peace and the U.S. imperialists are its main target. All the countries and people in the world desirous of peace should resolutely struggle against the U.S. imperialists' moves for aggression and war.
					
					The Korean Peninsula has become the most dangerous hotbed of war in the world. Once a war breaks out on the peninsula, it will quickly develop into a world war. In that case, the existence of humankind will be put in danger and the world peace and security disturbed. 
					
					Peace can be firmly guaranteed only with dependable military power. It is the basic mission of the armed forces in the DPRK to realize and protect the aspiration and wishes of the Korean people for the security and peace of the country by force of arms.
					
					The world progressive people are required to wage a more dynamic struggle to defend peace in order to ensure international security and development.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities' Politically Motivated Suppression of Chongryon under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities' Politically Motivated Suppression of Chongryon under Fire
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- "A meeting of Koreans in Japan to condemn the illegal and unwarranted politically motivated suppression and human rights abuses perpetrated by the Japanese authorities against the commercial organizations and Korean workers in commerce" took place in Tokyo on Dec. 6.
					Present there were officials including Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and its vice-chairmen, advisers to the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, the chairman of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon, the president of the Standing Council of the Federation of Korean Workers in Commerce in Japan, the chairman of the Tokyo Metropolitan Association of Korean Workers in Commerce in Japan, chairmen of the headquarters of Chongryon in various regions and compatriots.
					
					Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, in his report made at the meeting bitterly condemned the Japanese authorities for perpetrating politically motivated brutal suppression and human rights abuses against the commercial organizations and Korean workers in commerce on behalf of all officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan.
					
					He accused Japan of groundlessly finding fault with Chongryon, persistently sidestepping the issue of settling its past, a core issue in the DPRK-Japan relations, and pursuing the policy of undisguised crackdown on Koreans in Japan by using state power.
					
					He charged that through such campaign Japan seeks a sinister aim to weaken the commercial organizations and tear off Korean workers in commerce from the organization of Chongryon and thus destroy it. It is its ulterior motive to tarnish the image of Chongryon and its commercial organizations with an eye to isolate them from Japanese people, he added.
					
					He called on all officials of Chongryon and commercial organizations to unite closer around Chongryon and wage a more dynamic struggle with the unshakable will that they are sure to triumph as long as they are under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and firm faith in the justice of their activities.
					
					A report on the truth about the Japanese police's crackdown on Chongryon and commercial organizations was made at the meeting.
					
					Shinko Fukuyama, director general of the "Peace Forum", and Sumiko Shimizu, representative of the Japanese Women's Liaison Council for Solidarity with the Korean Women, made solidarity speeches. Solidarity messages from the committees of the north, the south and overseas sides for implementing the June 15 joint declaration were introduced before protest speeches were made by representatives of compatriots of various strata.
					
					Messages of protest to the Japanese government and the Metropolitan Police Office were adopted and a group of protesters made up of representatives of various circles was formed at the meeting.

articles.title: Immortal Revolutionary Exploits of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk Praised in UK
articles.content:
Immortal Revolutionary Exploits of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk Praised in UK
Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain was held in London on November 29.
					Dermot Hudson, representative of the branch, made a report at the meeting.
					
					He said he was deeply impressed to visit the DPRK in last October. He continued:
					
					I saw for myself the successes made by the Korean people and the bright faces of children convinced me of the future of the DPRK.
					
					Extreme individual selfishness prevails in the UK, but the spirit of collectivism is running high in the DPRK.
					
					He highly praised General Secretary Kim Jong Il and woman general of Mt. Paektu Kim Jong Suk for their immortal revolutionary feats, noting that the branch will greet before long the 17th anniversary of his assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 91st birth anniversary of the anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					Then, the meeting discussed issues of strengthening the work of the branch and intensifying the activities for solidarity with the Korean people. 
					
					A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral al feretro del difunto Wi In Chan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral al feretro del difunto Wi In Chan
Pyongyang, 9 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio el dia 8 una ofrenda floral al feretro del difunto Wi In Chan, ex combatiente revolucionario antijapones, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Minju Joson revela inmoralidad de la "guerra antiterrorista"
articles.content:
Minju Joson revela inmoralidad de la "guerra antiterrorista"
Pyongyang, 9 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Segun revelaciones recientes, la Agencia de Seguridad Nacional de Estados Unidos habia interceptado periodicamente en el ano 2003 los dialogos telefonicos entre el entonces premier britanico Tony Blair y el primer jefe del gobierno provisional de Irak, al Yawer.
					Esto quiere decir que EE.UU. mantenia bajo rigurosa vigilancia hasta a Gran Bretana y el gobierno provisional de Irak, que en aquellos momentos eran sus "aliados" mas cercanos del mundo en la "guerra antiterrorista".
					
					Este hecho insinua que la "guerra antiterrorista" al estilo norteamericano es muy problematica tambien en lo moral y son victimas de ella todos los paises y personas del mundo.
					
					Senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual divulgado este martes y continua: 
					
					En la actualidad, EE.UU. infringe en todos los rincones del orbe la soberania de los Estados soberanos, comete genocidios contra los inocentes civiles y viola constantemente sus derechos humanos.
					
					Si bien estas acciones contravienen a la ley internacional y a la Carta de la ONU, EE.UU. las justifica diciendo que sus operaciones militares son incuestionables porque forman parte de la "guerra antiterrorista".
					
					A partir de esta logica gangsteril, EE.UU. invadio a Irak y Afganistan y hace poco, cometio el ataque aereo contra Pakistan, Estado soberano, cegando la vida de numerosos habitantes pacificos.
					
					La sociedad internacional demanda unanimemente el cese de esta criminal "guerra antiterrorista", que resulta perjudicial y sirve de pretexto para la agresion militar y la violacion de la soberania de otros paises.
					
					La "guerra antiterrorista" lanzada por EE.UU. no pasa de ser un aparato para realizar su politica exterior dominacionista.
					
					EE.UU. debe dejar de cometer ahora mismo sus actos descarados que se burlan de la sociedad internacional bajo el enganoso cartel de "antiterrorismo".

articles.title: Periodicos condenan represion contra Chongryon en Japon
articles.content:
Periodicos condenan represion contra Chongryon en Japon
Pyongyang, 9 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Los periodicos capitalinos publicaron este martes sendos comentarios individuales condenando las maniobras represivas de los reaccionarios japoneses contra la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon).
					El diario Rodong Sinmun recuerda que la Oficina de Seguridad Publica de la Agencia de Policia de Tokio registro el 27 de noviembre por la fuerza la Asociacion de los Comerciantes e Industriales Coreanos en Japon y arresto sin ton ni son al ex vicepresidente de la Asociacion de Comerciantes e Industriales Coreanos Residentes en Shinjuku de la Metropoli de Tokio y luego al jefe del departamento de asuntos generales de esta entidad, y califica estos sucesos de canallada cometida sin respetar la ley ni los derechos humanos ni la etica y moral.
					
					Esta brutal campana anti-Chongryon es la manifestacion de la ya extremada politica hostil a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, precisa el rotativo y prosigue:
					
					Al acosar ferozmente a la Chongryon, los reaccionarios japoneses tratan de tomar venganza contra la RPDC e intentan evitar su aislamiento internacional y bancarrota.
					
					Debido a esta brutal represion, que llega ahora en la peor etapa despues del fin de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, se ve gravemente amenazado el derecho a la vida de la Chongryon y los coreanos residentes en Japon.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses son la pandilla de bribones, groseros y bandidos sin ni una pizca de conciencia, humanitarismo ni moralidad.
					
					Esa acometida resulta mas sucia y barbara si se tiene en cuenta que los coreanos radicados en Japon viven afligidos y acongojados por estar apartados de la patria.
					
					Sera balanceado sin falta el acto criminal de los reaccionarios japoneses, que prosiguen la campana represora anti-Chongryon practicando la politica hostil a la RPDC.
					
					Por su parte, el periodico Minju Joson indica que las maniobras anti-Chongryon de los reaccionarios japoneses son producto de la anacronica politica hostil a la RPDC y subraya que ellos deben portarse con juicio al distinguir el gran odio hacia Japon que tiene el pueblo coreano.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun rechaza nueva demagogia de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun rechaza nueva demagogia de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 9 de diciembre (ATCC) -- En estos dias, la horda de traidores del Sur de Corea, incluyendo el "Ministerio de Reunificacion" y el "Gran Partido Nacional", libran una campana demagogica anti-RPDC mintiendo que esta "destruyo las relaciones Sur-Norte".
					Al mismo tiempo, defienden su "politica sobre el Norte" y amparan el lanzamiento de volantes de contenido anti-RPDC por parte de las entidades conservadoras ultraderechistas.
					
					Por otra parte, hablan hipocritamente del supuesto "dialogo entre las autoridades" como si estuvieran interesados en las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					El diario Rodong Sinmun difundio este martes un comentario individual calificando tales acciones de maniobras premeditadas para encubrir sus crimenes de haber llevado las relaciones Norte-Sur a la fase catastrofica, evadir la responsabilidad por el respecto y realizar su malsana intencion bajo el rotulo del "dialogo".
					
					Son precisamente los compinches de Lee Myung Bak los que hicieron regresar a la confrontacion las relaciones N-S en desarrollo favorable al negar la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre e impedir la implementacion de estos documentos intercoreanos.
					
					Sin embargo, al silenciar esos crimenes nunca expiables, esta camarilla trata descaradamente de imputar a la RPDC, que hizo todos los esfuerzos sinceros por impedir el empeoramiento de las relaciones bilaterales, la responsabilidad por la ruptura de estos vinculos.
					
					La banda de Lee no puede ocultar de ninguna manera su naturaleza antinacional y anti-reunificacion, a partir de la cual se hizo oponente testarudo al mejoramiento de las relaciones intercoreanas y a la reunificacion de la patria. 
					
					La banda de Lee pagara muy caro sus crimenes nunca perdonables.
